file.name: pr_E1hr_CNRM-CM6-1_highresSST-present_r1i1p1f1_gr_%start_date%_%end_date%
file.variable: Forced global atmosphere-land simulations using daily 1/4 degree SST and sea-ice forcings, and aerosol optical properties (not emissions) to constrain model spread
data regridded to a T127 gaussian grid (128x256 latlon) from a native atmosphere T127l reduced gaussian grid
CNRM (Centre National de Recherches Meteorologiques, Toulouse 31057, France), CERFACS (Centre Europeen de Recherche et de Formation Avancee en Calcul Scientifique, Toulouse 31100, France)

CMIP6 model data produced by CNRM (Centre National de Recherches Meteorologiques, Toulouse 31057, France), CERFACS (Centre Europeen de Recherche et de Formation Avancee en Calcul Scientifique, Toulouse 31100, France) is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-[NonCommercial-]ShareAlike 4.0 International License (https://creativecommons.org/licenses). Consult https://pcmdi.llnl.gov/CMIP6/TermsOfUse for terms of use governing CMIP6 output, including citation requirements and proper acknowledgment. Further information about this data, including some limitations, can be found via the further_info_url (recorded as a global attribute in this file)[ and at http://www.umr-cnrm.fr/cmip6/]. The data producers and data providers make no warranty, either express or implied, including, but not limited to, warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose. All liabilities arising from the supply of the information (including any liability arising in negligence) are excluded to the fullest extent permitted by law.

A character string containing a list of published or web-based references that describe the data or the methods used to produce it.Typically, the user should provide references describing the modelformulation here

CNRM-CM6-1 (2016): aerosol: climatological fields computed by TACTIC (v2.0) atmos: Arpege 6.2 (Tl127; 91 levels; top level 78.4 km) atmosChem: OZL_v2 land: Surfex 8.0c ocean: Nemo 3.6 (eORCA1; tripolar primarily 1deg latitude/longitude;75 levels; top grid cell 0-1 m) seaIce: Gelato 6.1
CNRM-CM6-1 model output prepared for CMIP6 / CMIP Forced-Atmos-Land
Start date chosen so that variant r1i1p1f1 has the better fit with Krakatoa impact on tos

field.name: pr
field.variable: includes both liquid and solid phases

CNRM-CM6-1 (2016): aerosol: climatological fields computed by TACTIC (v2.0) atmos: Arpege 6.2 (Tl127; 91 levels; top level 78.4 km) atmosChem: OZL_v2 land: Surfex 8.0c ocean: Nemo 3.6 (eORCA1; tripolar primarily 1deg latitude/longitude;75 levels; top grid cell 0-1 m) seaIce: Gelato 6.1
CNRM-CM6-1 model output prepared for CMIP6 / CMIP Forced-Atmos-Land
Start date chosen so that variant r1i1p1f1 has the better fit with Krakatoa impact on tos

field.name: pr
field.variable: includes both liquid and solid phases

field.name: clwc

Mass Fraction of Convective Cloud Liquid Water

data regridded to a T127 gaussian grid (128x256 latlon) from a native atmosphere T127l reduced gaussian grid
CNRM (Centre National de Recherches Meteorologiques, Toulouse 31057, France), CERFACS (Centre Europeen de Recherche et de Formation Avancee en Calcul Scientifique, Toulouse 31100, France)

CMIP6 model data produced by CNRM (Centre National de Recherches Meteorologiques, Toulouse 31057, France), CERFACS (Centre Europeen de Recherche et de Formation Avancee en Calcul Scientifique, Toulouse 31100, France) is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-[NonCommercial-]ShareAlike 4.0 International License (https://creativecommons.org/licenses). Consult https://pcmdi.llnl.gov/CMIP6/TermsOfUse for terms of use governing CMIP6 output, including citation requirements and proper acknowledgment. Further information about this data, including some limitations, can be found via the further_info_url (recorded as a global attribute in this file)[ and at http://www.umr-cnrm.fr/cmip6/]. The data producers and data providers make no warranty, either express or implied, including, but not limited to, warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose. All liabilities arising from the supply of the information (including any liability arising in negligence) are excluded to the fullest extent permitted by law.

A character string containing a list of published or web-based references that describe the data or the methods used to produce it.Typically, the user should provide references describing the modelformulation here

CNRM-CM6-1 (2016): aerosol: climatological fields computed by TACTIC (v2.0) atmos: Arpege 6.2 (Tl127; 91 levels; top level 78.4 km) atmosChem: OZL_v2 land: Surfex 8.0c ocean: Nemo 3.6 (eORCA1; tripolar primarily 1deg latitude/longitude;75 levels; top grid cell 0-1 m) seaIce: Gelato 6.1
CNRM-CM6-1 model output prepared for CMIP6 / CMIP Forced-Atmos-Land
Start date chosen so that variant r1i1p1f1 has the better fit with Krakatoa impact on tos

field.name: clivi
field.variable: mass of ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating frozen hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

data regridded to a T127 gaussian grid (128x256 latlon) from a native atmosphere T127l reduced gaussian grid
CNRM (Centre National de Recherches Meteorologiques, Toulouse 31057, France), CERFACS (Centre Europeen de Recherche et de Formation Avancee en Calcul Scientifique, Toulouse 31100, France)

CMIP6 model data produced by CNRM (Centre National de Recherches Meteorologiques, Toulouse 31057, France), CERFACS (Centre Europeen de Recherche et de Formation Avancee en Calcul Scientifique, Toulouse 31100, France) is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-[NonCommercial-]ShareAlike 4.0 International License (https://creativecommons.org/licenses). Consult https://pcmdi.llnl.gov/CMIP6/TermsOfUse for terms of use governing CMIP6 output, including citation requirements and proper acknowledgment. Further information about this data, including some limitations, can be found via the further_info_url (recorded as a global attribute in this file)[ and at http://www.umr-cnrm.fr/cmip6/]. The data producers and data providers make no warranty, either express or implied, including, but not limited to, warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose. A character string containing a list of published or web-based references that describe the data or the methods used to produce it.Typically, the user should provide references describing the modelformulation here

CNRM-CM6-1 (2016): aerosol: climatological fields computed by TACTIC (v2.0) atmos: Arpege 6.2 (Tl127; 91 levels; top level 78.4 km) atmosChem: OZL_v2 land: Surfex 8.0c ocean: Nemo 3.6 (eORCA1; tripolar primarily 1deg latitude/longitude;75 levels; top grid cell 0-1 m) seaIce: Gelato 6.1
CNRM-CM6-1 model output prepared for CMIP6 / CMIP Forced-Atmos-Land
Start date chosen so that variant r1i1p1f1 has the better fit with Krakatoa impact on tos

field.name: dryoa
field.variable: Tendency of atmosphere mass content of organic dry aerosol due to dry deposition: This is the sum of dry deposition of POA and dry deposition of SOA (see next two entries). 'Mass' refers to the mass of organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone. We recommend a scale factor of POM=1.4*OC, unless your model has more detailed info available. Was called dry_pom in old ACCMIP Excel table. Dry deposition includes gravitational settling, impact scavenging, and turbulent deposition.
dry deposition rate of dry aerosol total organic matter

field.name: emioa

We recommend a scale factor of POM=1.4*OC, unless your model has more detailed info available. Integrate 3D chemical production and emission field vertically to 2d field.
primary emission and chemical production of dry aerosol organic matter

field.name: lwsnl
field.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
field.variable: The total mass of liquid water contained interstitially within the whole depth of the snow layer of the land portion of a grid cell divided by the area of the land portion of the cell.
Liquid Water Content of Snow Layer

field.name: tsn
field.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean (with samples weighted by snow mass)
field.variable: This temperature is averaged over all the snow in the grid cell that rests on land or land ice. When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the mass of snow on the land portion of the grid cell, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights. Reported as missing in regions free of snow on land.
area: mean where land time: mean (with samples weighted by snow mass)

data regridded to a T127 gaussian grid (128x256 latlon) from a native atmosphere T127l reduced gaussian grid
CNRM (Centre National de Recherches Meteorologiques, Toulouse 31057, France), CERFACS (Centre Europeen de Recherche et de Formation Avancee en Calcul Scientifique, Toulouse 31100, France)

CMIP6 model data produced by CNRM (Centre National de Recherches Meteorologiques, Toulouse 31057, France), CERFACS (Centre Europeen de Recherche et de Formation Avancee en Calcul Scientifique, Toulouse 31100, France) is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-[NonCommercial-]ShareAlike 4.0 International License (https://creativecommons.org/licenses). Consult https://pcmdi.llnl.gov/CMIP6/TermsOfUse for terms of use governing CMIP6 output, including citation requirements and proper acknowledgment. Further information about this data, including some limitations, can be found via the further_info_url (recorded as a global attribute in this file)[ and at http://www.umr-cnrm.fr/cmip6/]. The data producers and data providers make no warranty, either express or implied, including, but not limited to, warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose. A character string containing a list of published or web-based references that describe the data or the methods used to produce it.Typically, the user should provide references describing the modelformulation here

CNRM-CM6-1 (2016): aerosol: climatological fields computed by TACTIC (v2.0) atmos: Arpege 6.2 (Tl127; 91 levels; top level 78.4 km) atmosChem: OZL_v2 land: Surfex 8.0c ocean: Nemo 3.6 (eORCA1; tripolar primarily 1deg latitude/longitude;75 levels; top grid cell 0-1 m) seaIce: Gelato 6.1
CNRM-CM6-1 model output prepared for CMIP6 / CMIP Forced-Atmos-Land
Start date chosen so that variant r1i1p1f1 has the better fit with Krakatoa impact on tos

field.name: tas
field.variable: tas diagnostic uses a special scheme in this simulation

field.name: clwvi
field.variable: Mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

CNRM-CM6-1 (2016): aerosol: climatological fields computed by TACTIC (v2.0) atmos: Arpege 6.2 (Tl127; 91 levels; top level 78.4 km) atmosChem: OZL_v2 land: Surfex 8.0c ocean: Nemo 3.6 (eORCA1; tripolar primarily 1deg latitude/longitude;75 levels; top grid cell 0-1 m) seaIce: Gelato 6.1
CNRM-CM6-1 model output prepared for CMIP6 / CMIP Forced-Atmos-Land
Start date chosen so that variant r1i1p1f1 has the better fit with Krakatoa impact on tos
